content:
There's traverse which is good for any applicative, but it requires DecidableEq, which I've been able to avoid so far.

There's doing filterMap followed by checking if the length decreased, but it's a bit kludgey and I'll need to prove that isSome flattened <-> fs.all isSome, so I'd like the code to start with something like that.

One option that would have been nice is using Subtype, but Finset.map doesn't give me access to the fact that the argument is an element of the Finset, and I see no way to create a Finset {some subtype of Option t} out of fs.
It's not quite what you want but it's close

attach is exactly what I needed, not sure how I missed it.
Thanks.
Christophe Biocca has marked this topic as resolved.
